source.title: Cholinergic suppression of hippocampal sharp-wave ripples impairs working memory
source.venue: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences

confidence_rationale: Task-phase-dependent septo-hippocampal cholinergic modulation impacting SWRs and performance supports a control-gated trajectory mechanism rather than a monolithic always-on trajectory policy.

mapping.source_claim_statement: Manipulating septal cholinergic drive can suppress hippocampal SWRs and impair working-memory performance in a phase-dependent manner.
mapping.ree_translation: Supports implementing explicit state/phase guardrails around trajectory-first operations in MECH-056, with gating tied to control-plane context.
mapping.mapping_caveat: Specific neuromodulatory axis and task context; does not by itself specify full REE guardrail policy.
mapping.source_context: Optogenetic and photometry-based septo-hippocampal intervention during working-memory behavior.

confidence_components.notes: Strong mechanistic manipulation evidence for gating dependence, with moderate transfer risk to generalized architecture.
